title: Error 'undefined is not a function...' if turn on biometric authentification
body:
### Description

[comment]: # (Feature or Bug? i.e Type: Bug)
*Type*: Bug

[comment]: # (Describe the feature you would like, or briefly summarise the bug and what you did, what you expected to happen, and what actually happens. Sections below)
*Summary*: Error undefined is not a function (near '...l(a[234]).default.$p...') is shown if enable biometric authentification on both iOS and Android real devices.
```

```
#### Expected behavior

[comment]: # (Describe what you expected to happen.)
toggle "Use biometric authentication" is enabled
#### Actual behavior

Error undefined is not a function (near '...l(a[234]).default.$p...')

![Screenshot_20190602-173517](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/6584810/58763604-0c84e700-855d-11e9-9b74-a1ead149cb7e.png)


### Reproduction

[comment]: # (Describe how we can replicate the bug step by step.)

- Install Status and create new account
- Open Profile -> Advanced -> enable Development mode
- tap on Use biometric authentification
- check if any error is shown


### Additional Information

[comment]: # (Please do your best to fill this out.)
- Status version: nightly build from 2019/06/02 03:24:41 UTC: https://status-im.ams3.digitaloceanspaces.com/StatusIm-190602-025900-34300c-nightly.apk

[comment]: # (Android or iOS.)
- Operating System: Android 9, real Pixel XL and iOS 12.2, real iphone 7 plus 

#### Logs
[Status.log](https://github.com/status-im/status-react/files/3244937/Status.log)
